option.name: title_text
option.value: WEB STORYBOARD - Are YOU Smarter than a 5th Grader?

search.slidetext: click to find out click to find out click to find out are you smarter than a 5th grader? your 6th grade teachers want to know…

click continue to learn how to play continue continue continue you are going to play 5 episodes of are you smarter than a 5th grader? your goal is to prove that you are, in fact, smarter than a 5th grade math student! the challenge: dust off the cobwebs!

don’t worry if you’ve never seen the game show before. click through the 5 screens below (using the dots) to familiarize yourself with this week’s challenge. once you have viewed all screens, click the right arrow in the lower right-hand corner of your computer screen. what is this game show all about?
warm-up 1 compete 2 prepare 3 game play instructions

continue continue continue continue continue continue your answers have been recorded submit submit submit submit submit submit 1 2 3 4 5 before beginning, you need to think about how well you think you can tackle this challenge. rate each of the statements below. 1/no way 2/probably not 3/it could go either way 4/pretty sure 5/absolutely i’m smarter than a 5th grader i know more math than a 5th grader i could beat my parent at this game i could beat my grandparent at this game i could beat mrs. rolf at this game survey questions

(1) identify the origin, x axis, and y axis of the coordinate plane (2) graph ordered pairs & name points in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane (3) graph ordered pairs from a rule such as y=2x on a coordinate plane (1) identify the origin, x axis, and y axis of the coordinate plane (2) graph ordered pairs & name points in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane (3) graph ordered pairs from a rule such as y=2x on a coordinate plane (1) collect, represent, & interpret data (tables, charts, bar graphs, etc.) (2) label 3d objects and their parts & classify 2d objects based on characteristics (3) calculate volume of rectangular prisms (1) collect, represent, & interpret data (tables, charts, bar graphs, etc.) (2) label 3d objects and their parts & classify 2d objects based on characteristics (3) calculate volume of rectangular prisms (1) add & subtract mixed numbers (unlike denominators) (2) multiply & divide fractions (3) solve real world problems using equations, mixed #’s, and addition/subtraction (1) add & subtract mixed numbers (unlike denominators) (2) multiply & divide fractions (3) solve real world problems using equations, mixed #’s, and addition/subtraction (1) multiply & divide multiple-digit numbers (2) all decimal operations (3) multiply & divide by powers of 10 & convert units in standard/metric system (1) multiply & divide multiple-digit numbers (2) all decimal operations (3) multiply & divide by powers of 10 & convert units in standard/metric system (1) round decimals (3) compare fractions, mixed numbers, & decimal (2) powers of 10 [exponents] (4) equivalent fractions, decimals, & percent (1) round decimals (3) compare fractions, mixed numbers, & decimal (2) powers of 10 [exponents] (4) equivalent fractions, decimals, & percent ep 5 ep 5 ep 5 ep 5 ep 4 ep 4 ep 4 ep 4 ep 3 ep 3 ep 3 ep 3 ep 2 ep 2 ep 2 ep 2 ep 1 ep 1 ep 1 ep 1 episode categories click each episode below to see what topics will be covered each day.

episode 1 episode 1 episode 1 1 1 1 episode 4 episode 4 episode 4 4 4 4 episode 2 episode 2 episode 2 2 2 2 episode 5 episode 5 episode 5 5 5 5 episode 3 episode 3 episode 3 3 3 3 complete the episodes in order. to access an episode, click on the orange block. first, you will answer the questions within that episode, then you will practice for the next day’s episode. check off each task as you go – using the white boxes. don’t forget don’t forget don’t forget main menu game completed practice completed game completed practice completed game completed practice completed game completed practice completed game completed practice completed to keep track of what you have completed each day by checking the boxes.
ready to meet the competition? episode 1
today’s 5th grader may live in a pineapple under the sea; but, his teachers say he soaks up knowledge like a sponge… today’s 5th grade contestant you

(1) identify the origin, x axis, and y axis of the coordinate plane (2) graph ordered pairs & name points in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane (3) graph ordered pairs from a rule such as y=2x on a coordinate plane (1) identify the origin, x axis, and y axis of the coordinate plane (2) graph ordered pairs & name points in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane (3) graph ordered pairs from a rule such as y=2x on a coordinate plane (1) collect, represent, & interpret data (tables, charts, bar graphs, etc.) (2) label 3d objects and their parts & classify 2d objects based on characteristics (3) calculate volume of rectangular prisms (1) collect, represent, & interpret data (tables, charts, bar graphs, etc.) (2) label 3d objects and their parts & classify 2d objects based on characteristics (3) calculate volume of rectangular prisms (1) add & subtract mixed numbers (unlike denominators) (2) multiply & divide fractions (3) solve real world problems using equations, mixed #’s, and addition/subtraction (1) add & subtract mixed numbers (unlike denominators) (2) multiply & divide fractions (3) solve real world problems using equations, mixed #’s, and addition/subtraction (1) multiply & divide multiple-digit numbers (2) all decimal operations (3) multiply & divide by powers of 10 & convert units in standard/metric system (1) multiply & divide multiple-digit numbers (2) all decimal operations (3) multiply & divide by powers of 10 & convert units in standard/metric system (1) round decimals (3) compare fractions, mixed numbers, & decimal (2) powers of 10 [exponents] (4) equivalent fractions, decimals, & percent (1) round decimals (3) compare fractions, mixed numbers, & decimal (2) powers of 10 [exponents] (4) equivalent fractions, decimals, & percent ep 5 ep 5 ep 5 ep 5 ep 4 ep 4 ep 4 ep 4 ep 3 ep 3 ep 3 ep 3 ep 2 ep 2 ep 2 ep 2 ep 1 ep 1 ep 1 ep 1 ep 1 episode categories here is a reminder of today’s game categories
